ul.li: Santa Clara Valley, California, United States

div.p:
Our team is looking for a talented DevOps engineer who is passionate about building systems and continuous delivery to deploy new Siri functionality to internal users and customers as soon as possible. You will play a key role in designing and building tools and systems that Siri, and other teams at Apple, will use to implement and monitor automated development pipelines.
Join the Siri team!

ul.li: Experience with Software Version Control systems: GIT, SVN, (GitHub knowledge or Administration is a plus)
Experience with languages including: Java and Python
Maintained or Architected large project builds using Gradle or Maven
Ability to administer build systems such as Artifactory, Jenkins, TeamCity Bamboo
A desire to write tools and applications to automate work rather then do everything by hand
Experience using configuration tools such as: Puppet, Chef, Salt, Docker

div.p: You will play a part in the next revolution in human-computer interaction. You will contribute to a product that is redefining mobile computing. You will create groundbreaking technology for large-scale systems, spoken language, big data, and artificial intelligence. You will also work with the people who created the intelligent assistant that helps millions of people get things done — just by asking.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Information Systems or 5 + years equivalent experience in an engineering role.

- Experience implementing Java server applications using tools such as: Jersey, Jetty, ZooKeeper, JDBC, JMS, JMX and cloud deployment tools - Linux system administration experience: ssh, monitoring processes, attaching storage, cleaning disk space, tailing logs, etc. - Experience using Docker or other container systems - Experience working with server clusters consisting of hundreds or thousands of machines using tools such as: AWS, OpenStack, Mesos etc.
